item.title: GPS spoofing incidents spike 400%: Does it make a plane crash? What should we know
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers reported a significant rise in GPS spoofing incidents targeting commercial airliners, particularly near conflict zones. Unauthorized systems broadcast false positions, leading to disruptions, including the manipulation of aircraft clocks. In one instance, a plane's clocks advanced by years, disabling its communication systems and grounding it for weeks. While not directly causing crashes, these incidents could lead to serious complications.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump's campaign says it has been hacked, blames Iranian hackers
item.description: ​Politico said it started receiving emails on July 22 from an anonymous sender. The person identified himself as Robert and used an AOL mail account. The documents that Robert sent to Politico were authentic -- it was a preliminary version of Vance's vetting file. The research dossier was a 271-page document based on publicly available information about Vance’s past record and statements, with some — such as his past criticisms of Trump — identified in the document as “POTENTIAL VULNERABILITIES.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says 'no one knows Kamala Harris' last name'. And then says it
item.description: Donald Trump's Montana rally Friday was his first as he resumes campaigning after his rival Harris-Walz camp scored big in creating buzz. As Donald Trump criticized Kamala Harris, he made a bizarre claim that no one knows Kamala Harris' last name. “Kamala Harris. You know it’s interesting nobody really knows her last name,” he said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Trump said 'I think I was right' after 'Kamala Harris Black or Indian' remark
item.description: Donald Trump is adamant on his comment doubting Kamala Harris' ethnicity between Black and Indian though his campaign might have suffered from the remark that he first made in Chicago. Trump said he was not sure whether Kamala Harris was Indian or Black because before 'turning' Black, Kamala Harris emphasized on his Indian roots.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Joe Rogan's flip-flop on Donald Trump and RFK Jr: "Most American f***ing things'
item.description: Joe Rogan offered the quickest flip-flop as he on Thursday endorsed Robert F Kennedy Jr's independent presidential campaign and then on Friday said Donald Trump's action of raising his fist after a bullet grazed his ear was "one of the most American f***ing things of all time".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I couldn't care less': Did Trump explain why he calls Harris 'Kamabla'?
item.description: Former president Donald Trump has been referring to Kamala Harris as 'Kamabla' -- a term which has no explained meaning. There are speculations that it is a willful distortion of Kamala's name to incorporate Black in it, or that Trump has been suggesting that 'Kamala Harris is blah'. But there has been no explanation given until Trump addressed his habit of 'bad name calling'. At the rally, Trump said he has frequently mispronounced Kamala Harris' name but he couldn't care less how it should be pronounced.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ​Global leaders in industrial automation: Top countries by robotic integration
'Angry' Donald Trump calls NYT over helicopter fact check: 'Yes, he was in a scary ride'
item.description: The New York Times Saturday published a report confirming that Donald Trump was indeed on a rocky helicopter ride as he earlier claimed. But it was not with Willie Brown, the former San Francisco mayor, Kamala Harris' ex-boyfriend as Trump claimed in his press conference Thursday. On Friday, NYT said the 'jaw-dropping story' that Trump told about nearly dying in a helicopter ride actually never happened.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea launches more trash balloons towards South Korea: Seoul military
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump plays Kamala Harris' 'tough and bit*h' video at Montana rally: 'We are not weird'
item.description: If you listen to Kamala Harris' speech, you would not know that she has been running the country for four years, Donald Trump said at his Montana rally and then played a compilation of Kamala Harris' statements known as 'word salads'. The Montana rally Friday marked Donald Trump's return to the campaign after he took a hiatus and then addressed a press conference at his home Thursday,.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No, Tim Walz didn't carry weapons in war; Yes, he misspoke: Harris campaign clarifies
item.description: Amid the ongoing controversy over Tim Walz's military record, whether he opted out of the service just before his unit's deployment in Iraq, the Harris-Walz campaign took a step back and admitted that yes, Tim Walz "misspoke" when he talked about carrying weapons in war -- in 2018. The video resurfaced after Walz's rival Ohio senator JD Vance called Walz's military record as "stolen valor" and that he never went to war.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sierra Leone court sentences soldiers to long jail terms for failed coup
item.description: The sentences were read out in court late on Friday with the judge handing out prison terms ranging from 50 and 120 years on those convicted.
